clinical_study.brief_title: Program Evaluation of People With Arthritis Can Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Health Benefits of the People With Arthritis Can Exercise Program

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the health and arthritis-specific benefits of participation in the Arthritis Foundation People with Arthritis Can Exercise program and to collect information to improve community-based dissemination of this program.

primary_outcome.measure: Physical Activity Level - PASE instrument at baseline, 8 and 16 weeks.
Pain Visual Analog Scale - at baseline, 8 and 16 weeks
Physical Function using the Functional Fitness Battery at baseline, 8 and 16 weeks
Self-reported function (HAQ) at baseline, 8 and 16 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults age 18 and older
- Self-reported arthritis or chronic joint symptoms
- Community-dwelling
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious medical conditions which would contraindicate exercise
- No severe physical or mental condition
